pullRequest.title: Stash #2121
pullRequest.bodyText:
First, thanks for this great mod! I loved playing with it, so I wanted to give back a little!
Implements #2121
Changes proposed in this pull request:

Added a Stash, that will have items inside that the DeliveryMan will pickup and move to the Warehouse.

So, this incomplete PR is an attempt to implement #2121 , although just the first comment, as the second one I felt it was beyond the scope of the Stash, as I thought this should be kept to a minimal functionality.
Core Functionality
The Core functionality of how I thought was this: when an item gets deposited, it bumps the priority up to 10, to encourage the DeliveryMan to pickup items ASAP on them. When the DeliveryMan picks up the items, it drops the priority to a minimum. So the bumping and the dropping are being handled by the TileEntity and the Inventory Handler.
Found issues
I noticed that the dropping of the priority should be done automatically, but it's only done when it's the last building on the list? I didn't quite understand why this didn't work: 
  
    
      minecolonies/src/main/java/com/minecolonies/coremod/entity/ai/citizen/deliveryman/EntityAIWorkDeliveryman.java
    
    
         Line 217
      in
      1fdde5f
    
    
    
    

        
          
           building.alterPickUpPriority(-10); 
        
    
  


Temporary work
For now, I don't have a fixed GUI. Suggestions are welcome for functionality.
Also, I don't have a model. If you guys have a suggestion, one to spare or a software for me to take a look (I will try Blockbench).
Also, I don't know how you guys manage your language files, so, for now, I still have no lang strings for it.
Conclusion
I'll update after I have done more work, I just wanted to say the work is being done, and get feedback if you think the direction is right. For now, only the first commit actually needs to be looked at 135da01
Review and suggestions are welcome

commit.message:
Stash is added

This commit contains the logic behind the worker hut, the block and the TileEntity.
I've created a TileEntity as I've found no pratical way to change the `inventory` from `AbstractTileEntityRack` for all instances of Stash. This obviously can be changed if a better way comes up. For now, it's a protected field and has no way to be re-assigned, so this is what I came up.

GUI Work is totally temporary

The GUI is totally temporary for now, I just copied from other buildings. Also, I only managed to set the correct values when opened by using the `onOpened` event method, although it's not used anywhere else.

Texture and Model are temporary

I've just copied the PostBox for now, as I don't have a model for it yet.

Recipe is temporary as well

I thought of making it a double chest worth actually, but prolly 27 slots fits better the style.

Changes to existing files to support the Stash

Registering the Block, as well as the Stash Building, the GUI element and the TileEntity, as well as allowing to change priority on the Network messages.
Also, no lang files were edited, and the GUI needs a proper translation for Stash

Typo on my part

Was just testing stuff
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into version/1.15

nodes.bodyText: Can you format those to our code style and add javadoc?
I would probably not have it have a GUI at all. Only the inventory GUI should be enough.

commit.message:
New model

Derived from PostBox. I thought it would be better than to just re-use the same model

Removed the GUI

It only uses empty files to go around the checks from Validate.notNull, thus using a dummy empty view.

Update on block model's bounding box

Default 1 block size instead of a custom size.
Updated the logic to let the DeliveryMan reset the priority

Added the Stash to the ignore along with PostBox

But it's still not working when placing.
Merge branch 'version/1.15' of https://github.com/Shirkit/minecolonies into version/1.15
Javadocs
Formatting using CheckStyle plugin
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into version/1.15

nodes.bodyText: why do we need a different handling for IBuilding here? isn't it always an IBuilding or never?

I know this is a bit out of the scope of this PR. But maybe you're up to it. Maybe it makes sense to extract what Stash and PostBox need from AbstractBuilding into a separate abstract super class and have Stash and PostBox extend those.
So that we don't need the "!(building instanceof PostBox) && !(building instanceof Stash)" checks in a row, that might be cleaner.
Or at least an IRSComponent interface that both Stash and PostBox implement and we check only if !instanceof IRSComponent

commit.message:
Fixed model size while on inventory

Was overflowing to next tile
Merge branch 'version/1.15' of https://github.com/Shirkit/minecolonies into version/1.15

It's always IBuilding, so we can cast directly

And I always forget that we can cast null values without exceptions
Proper check and casting
Implemented IRSComponent
Added empty interface for non-schematic buildings
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into version/1.15
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into version/1.15
